newsitem.title: USA: Olympic Financial stock jumps on news of possible buyer.
newsitem.headline: Olympic Financial stock jumps on news of possible buyer.

text.p: The stock of Olympic Financial Ltd. jumped nearly 29 percent Monday after the nation's largest independent provider of auto financing said a buyer was interested in acquiring the company.
Olympic rose $5125 to $22.75 in afternoon trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
At the same time, the Minneapolis-based company said the company's chairman, president, chief executive and board member Jeffrey Mack resigned.
In an earlier statement, the company said that Mack "was terminated" due to what it called "philosophical differences with the board."
Olympic Financial did not indentify the potential buyer but analysts said the company has received an offer, possibly from a regional bank or a financial services concern.
"The obvious thought is that someone has made a good offer," said Bob Ollech, analyst at Principal Financial.
The company, which buys, sells and services retail instalment contracts for new and used automobiles, said that it had appointed Warren Kantor, a board member, as chairman of the executive committee.
